education.degree: M Tech (Online) in Electronics and Communication Engineering
Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics and Communication Engineering

Software Engineering Agents: Led the development of AI-driven agents to automate routine software engineering tasks, enhancing productivity across requirement analysis, software planning, code documentation, and test case generation.
Engineered and deployed a scalable decentralized database architecture using MongoDB and Azure OpenAI Services to handle exponential data growth and ensure high availability.
Developed RESTful APIs for seamless integration with tools like Jira, Confluence, GitHub, and Bitbucket, enabling robust and secure cross-platform communication.
Implemented advanced graph algorithms for efficient storage and retrieval in knowledge graphs, facilitating actionable insights for engineering teams.
Built a proprietary agent framework to auto-generate software diagrams, reusable code templates, and comprehensive design documentation adhering to coding standards.
Deployed custom CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and GitHub Actions, automating unit tests to ensure compatibility and reduce deployment efforts.
Designed and developed user-friendly interfaces using Streamlit and a VS Code extension to improve engineering workflows and accessibility.
Achieved 20x reduction in task completion time and a 10x decrease in redundant notifications by consolidating and aggregating actionable updates.
Surpassed quality benchmarks for auto-generated documentation and test cases, achieving compliance exceeding against team standards.
Supported high customer traffic APIs by implementing robust monitoring tools and delivering scalable solutions to optimize performance.

work_experience.company: Mercedes Benz Research and Development India Pvt Ltd

Multi Core Scheduling Framework: This framework allows the developers to create a static scheduler in multi-core embedded platforms by visualization of dependencies between the components.
Designed and develped a graph based visualization tool using yED graphml format to visualize the relationships between the components, their impact and relation types
Generation of scheduler source code from the visualizations, this helps in designing of static scheduler and placement in a easy way.
The generated source code is a production grade source code and compliant with all standards such as MISRA standards.
Automated unit-test generator for the scheduler to ensure complete code coverage

Further, using re-inforcement learning algorithms, the framework proposes a initial schedule by analyzing the relationships and dependencies, developers can then modify the proposed schdeuler to generate the source code.

achievements: Presented Technical papers during ADI's annual GTC events.
Participated in multiple global Ideathon and Hackathon events within the company.
